channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Over 1,000 UK prisoners get early release to ease prison overcrowding
item.description: The UK was on Tuesday due to release early a second batch of 1,000 prisoners as the government launches a review of sentencing to ease chronic overcrowding in jails. Mahmood said the early release scheme had been forced on the government by a prison crisis inherited from the last Conservative government.

item.title: ESA's Moonlight Program to create 400,000 km data network between Earth and Moon
item.description: The European Space Agency has launched the Moonlight Programme to establish Europe's first satellite constellation for lunar telecommunication and navigation. This initiative, involving the UK and Italy, aims to enable autonomous lunar operations and reduce costs, supporting over 400 planned lunar missions and fostering a lunar economy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: AI-generated video of Trump at McDonald's goes viral ahead of election
item.description: An AI-generated video of former President Donald Trump humorously tumbling out of a McDonald's drive-thru has become a viral sensation online. Trump's playful jab at Vice President Kamala Harris's claims of working at McDonald's in the 1980s has further fueled the debate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Halloween Comet' set to light up sky in Octoberâ€”But will it survive sun?
item.description: The newly discovered comet C/2024 S1, possibly a remnant of the Great Comet of 1106, will reach its closest approach to Earth on October 24. Expected to brighten the skies around Halloween, it may be visible during daylight, particularly on October 28 if it remains intact.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Shift among Jewish voters: More support for Trump?
item.description: As the 2024 election nears, some US Jewish voters in key states feel abandoned by the Democratic Party and may shift to Trump due to recent Hamas attacks. While most still support Democrats, the uncertainty and recent antisemitism may sway crucial votes, with both campaigns intensifying their outreach efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Undertaker hosts Trump on 'Six Feet Under', discuss realities of wrestling ring
item.description: Donald Trump appears on 'Six Feet Under' podcast with retired wrestling legend The Undertaker, showcasing his deep curiosity about professional wrestling's realities, physical toll, and behind-the-scenes tensions. Trump reflects on his WrestleMania involvement, acknowledging the scripted yet dangerous nature of pro wrestling.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Locker-room politics: What's behind Trump's lewd story about Arnold Palmer
item.description: Donald Trump intensifies vulgar language and hypermasculine rhetoric in the final weeks of the 2024 campaign, targeting male voters disillusioned by political correctness. This approach energizes his base but risks alienating suburban women and moderates, potentially widening the gender divide against Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I hope you get PTSD': Twitch streamer Frogan banned after controversial remarks for US soldiers
item.description: Twitch streamer Frogan received a 30-day suspension following a viral clip where she made inflammatory comments about the US military, wishing PTSD on soldiers lacking remorse. She later clarified that her comments were misinterpreted. Despite issuing an apology, the incident led to widespread backlash and discussions about the responsibilities of public figures on platforms like Twitch.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump inspects North Carolina post hurricane, criticises FEMA
item.description: Former President Donald Trump criticizes FEMA workers during a visit to North Carolina amid Hurricane Helene's impact. Trump renews unfounded claims about FEMA diverting resources, while state officials and the White House stress the importance of non-partisan recovery efforts and combating misinformation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China holds live-fire drills opposite Taiwan, week after large-scale exercise
item.description: China is holding live-fire drills off Fujian province near Taiwan, following a large air-and-sea drill in response to Taiwan's rejection of Beijing's sovereignty claims. The Maritime Safety Administration warned ships to avoid the area. Taiwan is monitoring these drills, which come amid heightened tensions and increased Chinese military presence around the island.

item.title: Hurricane Oscar wreaks havoc in Cuba, causing severe power outages
item.description: Cuba is grappling with its worst power outage since 2022 after Hurricane Oscar caused extensive blackouts, leaving six dead and sparking protests. Families face hardship without electricity, while the government warns against unrest. Emergency measures are in place, but many doubt a swift recovery as the economy suffers and thousands flee abroad.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump urges Christians to vote, claims Harris will restrict religious freedoms
item.description: Donald Trump urged Christian voters to participate in the 2024 election, positioning himself as a defender of religious freedoms and calling the election a spiritual issue. He recounted an assassination attempt that strengthened his faith and promised action against gender ideology while highlighting his decision to relocate the US embassy in Israel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia hosts BRICS leaders, signaling Putin is far from isolated
item.description: President Vladimir Putin is hosting a significant BRICS summit in Russia, with world leaders attending to discuss countering Western influence. Key topics include reducing reliance on the dollar and the potential expansion of BRICS, though countries like India and the UAE express reservations. The gathering highlights a shift in global power dynamics.

item.title: 'Did Nazi that coming': Elon Musk mocks Der Spiegel article with Hitler quip
item.description: Elon Musk reacted humorously on X to a German magazine likening him to Hitler. Musk's repost drew support from YouTuber Naomi Seibt, who defended him against accusations and criticized the articleâ€™s portrayal. The report also highlighted Muskâ€™s controversial views on US elections and immigration, suggesting that these stances contribute to his image as a political antagonist.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Israel killed my sister twice': Woman, who survived October 7 massacre, dies by suicide
item.description: Shirel Golan, a 22-year-old survivor of the Nova music festival massacre, took her own life on her birthday after struggling with PTSD for a year. Despite her family's efforts, they blamed the state for failing to provide proper support. Golan's brother accused the state of neglecting her mental health needs, urging immediate action to prevent more tragedies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Israel finds millions in cash, gold in Hezbollahâ€™s â€˜secretâ€™ bunker; see video
item.description: Israel's military has uncovered cash and gold worth hundreds of millions of dollars in a bunker beneath Beirut's Al-Sahel Hospital, allegedly built by Hezbollah's former leader. Despite these findings, Israel will not target the hospital, instead focusing on Hezbollahâ€™s financial assets. Lebanese officials dispute these claims.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Exonerated Central Park Five file defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump
item.description: The Exonerated Five, wrongly convicted in 1989 for a Central Park assault, filed a defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump for false statements made during a debate. Trump incorrectly claimed they killed someone and pleaded guilty. The lawsuit seeks damages for the harm caused, with their attorney stressing the pursuit of justice, not political motives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Will Hamas get a new chief after Yahya Sinwar's death? Here's what reports suggest
item.description: Following the death of Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar by Israeli forces, the group opts for a five-member ruling committee based in Doha instead of appointing a single successor. This interim committee, formed after political chief Ismail Haniyeh's assassination, will lead the movement until new internal elections scheduled for March.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Teen taken into custody after five family members shot dead in Washington home
item.description: A teenager has been detained after a tragic shooting in Fall City, Washington, left five people dead inside a home. The incident occurred around 5 am, resulting in the deaths of two adults and three teenagers. Another injured teen was taken to a Seattle hospital. Authorities have determined there is no ongoing threat to the community.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Moldova secures path toward EU membership in razor-thin vote
